title: TV Characters with the Hottest Winter Wardrobes
description: From chic capes to bold coats, these TV characters make winter fashion sizzle. See who made the list! The post TV Characters with the Hottest Winter Wardrobes appeared first on TV Fanatic.
author: Lisa Babick
excerpt: From chic capes to bold coats, these TV characters make winter fashion sizzle. Did your favorite make the list? Check it out!
text: Winter may be cold, but these TV characters know how to turn up the heat with their stunning seasonal style. From cozy coats to chic scarves, they’ve mastered the art of layering without sacrificing fashion. Whether they’re solving crimes, running empires, or simply walking the snowy streets of their TV worlds, these characters prove that looking good in winter is the ultimate power move. (Netflix/Screenshot) Winter fashion isn’t just about staying warm — it’s about making a statement, and these characters do it effortlessly. Ready to see who made the cut? Grab your warmest blanket and check out the TV characters with the hottest winter wardrobes! Chanel Oberlin — Scream Queens (Fox/Screenshot) Chanel Oberlin from Scream Queens doesn’t just dress for the season — she dominates it. Chanel makes winter fashion look effortless and high-end with her signature pastel coats, fur-trimmed capes, and glamorous accessories. She’s the queen of coordinating her wardrobe perfectly, proving that cold weather is no excuse to skimp on style. Whether she’s sipping hot cocoa or plotting her next scheme, Chanel’s winter wardrobe always steals the spotlight. After all, why blend in with the snow when you can shine brighter than a diamond? Watch Scream Queens Online Betty Draper — Mad Men (AMC/Screenshot) Betty Draper from Mad Men embodies timeless winter elegance. With her sophisticated coats, chic gloves, and perfectly styled hair, Betty’s cold-weather wardrobe is as polished as her socialite demeanor. She makes even the harshest winter day look like a runway moment, effortlessly blending classic silhouettes with cozy sophistication. Whether she’s attending a holiday party or braving the snowy streets of the ’60s suburbs, Betty’s style is a masterclass in vintage glamour. Winter may be chilly, but Betty always brings the heat! Watch Mad Men Online Blair Waldorf — Gossip Girl (The CW/Giovanni Rufino) Blair Waldorf from Gossip Girl is the undisputed queen of winter fashion. With her tailored coats, statement headbands, and luxurious scarves, Blair transforms the chilly streets of Manhattan into her personal runway. She knows how to layer with elegance, mixing textures and colors to create cozy and chic outfits. Whether she’s strolling through Central Park or scheming on the Upper East Side, Blair’s winter wardrobe screams sophistication. No snowstorm could ever dull her sparkle — she’s pure winter royalty! Watch Gossip Girl Online Rachel Green — Friends (NBC/Screenshot) Rachel Green from Friends brought her signature flair to winter fashion with effortless style. From oversized turtlenecks and sleek trench coats to chic knit beanies, Rachel proved that staying warm doesn’t mean sacrificing sophistication. As a fashion professional, she always knew how to pair timeless staples with trendy accents, creating practical and enviable looks. Whether she was braving the New York chill or lounging at Central Perk, Rachel’s winter wardrobe was as iconic as her hairstyles — and just as unforgettable! Watch Friends Online Lorelai Gilmore — Gilmore Girls (The WB/Screenshot) Lorelai Gilmore from Gilmore Girls is a quirky and cozy winter fashion queen. Lorelai’s cold-weather wardrobe is as charming as Stars Hollow, from her colorful knit hats to her endless array of stylish coats. She masters the art of layering, pairing bold scarves with playful sweaters that reflect her vibrant personality. Whether she’s sipping coffee at Luke’s or planning the next town festival, Lorelai’s outfits radiate warmth and whimsy. Snowy days and frosty nights never looked so fun — or fashionable! Watch Gilmore Girls Online Emily Cooper — Emily in Paris (Netflix/Screenshot) Emily Cooper from Emily in Paris brings Parisian chic to winter fashion with her bold, eye-catching ensembles. From statement coats in vibrant colors to berets that scream French sophistication, Emily’s wardrobe turns the city’s chilly streets into her personal catwalk. She’s never afraid to mix patterns, textures, or daring accessories, creating outfits that are as adventurous as her personality. Whether she’s navigating work drama or enjoying a snowy stroll by the Seine, Emily’s winter style is pure haute couture magic. Fashion faux pas? Not in her vocabulary! Watch Emily in Paris Online Villanelle — Killing Eve (BBC America/Screenshot) Villanelle from Killing Eve turns winter fashion into a deadly art form. With her love of bold silhouettes and luxurious fabrics, she effortlessly blends high fashion with a hint of danger. Whether she’s rocking a statement coat or a tailored ensemble fit for a spy thriller, Villanelle’s winter wardrobe commands attention. She treats every snowy backdrop like a runway, proving that style is a killer instinct even in the dead of winter. When it comes to turning heads, Villanelle never misses her mark. Watch Killing Eve Online Jessica Pearson — Suits (USA Network/Screenshot) Jessica Pearson from Suits redefines winter power dressing with her sleek and sophisticated wardrobe. Her tailored coats, luxurious scarves, and impeccably polished boots exude confidence and class, making every icy sidewalk her personal runway. Jessica’s style commands attention, blending sharp business chic with understated elegance that never sacrifices warmth. Whether she’s heading to court or owning the boardroom, her winter outfits are a masterclass in high-end professionalism. Cold weather has nothing on Jessica’s cool, collected fashion sense. Watch Suits Online Cookie Lyon — Empire (Chuck Hodes/FOX) Cookie Lyon from Empire brings unapologetic flair to winter fashion. With her bold fur coats, glittering accessories, and sky-high heels, Cookie doesn’t just brave the cold — she conquers it in style. Her wardrobe is all about making a statement, whether she’s handling family drama or running her music empire. Leopard print in a snowstorm? Absolutely. Cookie’s larger-than-life fashion ensures she’s always the center of attention, proving that even in winter, she’s a force to be reckoned with. Watch Empire Online Olivia Pope — Scandal (ABC/Adam Taylor) Olivia Pope from Scandal epitomizes winter elegance, combining practicality with high-end sophistication effortlessly. Her iconic tailored coat collection, luxurious capes, and perfectly draped scarves could make any chilly day feel glamorous. Olivia’s muted color palette and impeccable accessorizing reflect her no-nonsense approach, while her timeless style speaks volumes about her powerful presence. Whether she’s handling a crisis or sipping red wine at home, Olivia’s winter wardrobe is just as captivating as her command of the room. Watch Scandal Online Betty Cooper — Riverdale (The CW/Screenshot) Betty Cooper from Riverdale keeps winter fashion cozy and cute while staying true to her all-American charm. From her classic pea coats to soft, pastel sweaters, Betty’s wardrobe blends warmth with a touch of timeless style. Her signature ponytail might be a constant, but her scarves and hats add a playful twist to her cold-weather outfits. Whether she’s solving mysteries or grabbing milkshakes at Pop’s, Betty’s winter looks are effortlessly chic and totally relatable. Snowy small-town vibes never looked so good! Watch Riverdale Online Lady Mary Crawley — Downton Abbey (ITV/Screenshot) Lady Mary Crawley from Downton Abbey brings aristocratic elegance to winter fashion. Her tailored coats, luxurious furs, and delicate gloves showcase a refined style that’s as regal as the Crawley estate itself. Lady Mary’s winter wardrobe exudes sophistication, blending Edwardian grace with her bold, modern spirit. Whether she’s strolling the snowy grounds of Downton or attending a glamorous event, her outfits always command admiration. Winter may be harsh, but Lady Mary faces it with poise, charm, and impeccable style. Watch Downton Abbey Online Moira Rose — Schitt’s Creek (CBC Television/Screenshot) Moira Rose from Schitt’s Creek turns winter fashion into a theatrical spectacle. With her over-the-top fur coats, avant-garde hats, and a flair for the dramatic, Moira’s wardrobe is anything but ordinary. She layers bold patterns, textures, and statement accessories in ways only she can pull off, proving that fashion is art — even in a snowstorm. Whether she’s delivering a monologue or sipping her Herb Ertlinger fruit wine, Moira’s winter looks are as unforgettable as her one-liners. Who needs subtlety when you have Moira Rose? Watch Schitt's Creek Online Janine Teagues — Abbott Elementary (ABC/Screenshot) Janine Teagues from Abbott Elementary brings a relatable charm to winter fashion. With her cozy sweaters, practical coats, and colorful scarves, Janine’s style is all about staying warm while juggling the chaos of her classroom. She mixes comfort with a touch of whimsy, reflecting her optimistic and quirky personality. Whether she’s wrangling her students or navigating staff drama, Janine’s winter wardrobe is as endearing as her can-do spirit. Snowy days are no match for her sunny disposition and cute, practical outfits! Watch Abbott Elementary Online Julia (Julia) Available to watch on YouTube (NBC/Screenshot) Julia Baker from Julia redefined elegance with her understated yet polished winter wardrobe. Her chic coats, tailored ensembles, and tasteful accessories reflected the sophistication of a professional single mother navigating life with grace. Julia’s fashion wasn’t just stylish — it was aspirational, embodying the era’s push for modernity while staying timeless. Whether she was caring for her son or working as a nurse, her outfits radiated confidence and class. Julia’s winter style remains a testament to simplicity done right, proving that less is often more. Miriam “Midge” Maisel — The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel (Philippe Antonello/Prime Video) Miriam “Midge” Maisel from The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel dazzles in winter fashion with her vintage-inspired wardrobe, which is equal parts glamorous and playful. Her stunning coats in rich jewel tones, elegant gloves, and chic hats make every snowy New York sidewalk feel like a fashion runway. Midge’s style reflects her vibrant personality and impeccable taste, blending 1950s sophistication with a modern flair. Whether she’s performing on stage or navigating her next big break, Midge’s winter looks always steal the show. Watch The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Online Mabel Mora — Only Murders in the Building (Hulu/Craig Blankenhorn) Mabel Mora from Only Murders in the Building brings edgy sophistication to winter fashion. With her statement coats, bold beanies, and effortlessly cool layers, Mabel’s style is as mysterious as the cases she’s solving. She’s a master of mixing practicality with flair, making even a cold New York day look effortlessly chic. Whether she’s unraveling a murder mystery or making witty comebacks, Mabel’s winter wardrobe exudes confidence and urban cool. Snowfall or not, she’s always dressed to impress. Watch Only Murders in the Building Online Chilling in Style: Who Rocks Winter Wardrobes Best? (Giovanni Rufino/The CW) These TV characters prove that winter is the perfect time to showcase your fashion game. Whether it’s bold coats, cozy layers, or glamorous accessories, they’ve inspired us to embrace the season in style. Now it’s your turn — who do you think has the hottest winter wardrobe on TV? Did your favorite make the list, or do you have a frosty fashion icon we missed? Drop your picks in the comments, and let the wardrobe wars begin! Username or Email AddressPassword
html:
Winter may be cold, but these TV characters know how to turn up the heat with their stunning seasonal style.

From cozy coats to chic scarves, they’ve mastered the art of layering without sacrificing fashion.

Whether they’re solving crimes, running empires, or simply walking the snowy streets of their TV worlds, these characters prove that looking good in winter is the ultimate power move.

Winter fashion isn’t just about staying warm — it’s about making a statement, and these characters do it effortlessly.

Ready to see who made the cut?

Grab your warmest blanket and check out the TV characters with the hottest winter wardrobes!

Chanel Oberlin — Scream Queens

Chanel Oberlin from Scream Queens doesn’t just dress for the season — she dominates it.

Chanel makes winter fashion look effortless and high-end with her signature pastel coats, fur-trimmed capes, and glamorous accessories.

She’s the queen of coordinating her wardrobe perfectly, proving that cold weather is no excuse to skimp on style.

Whether she’s sipping hot cocoa or plotting her next scheme, Chanel’s winter wardrobe always steals the spotlight. After all, why blend in with the snow when you can shine brighter than a diamond?

Watch Scream Queens Online

Betty Draper — Mad Men

Betty Draper from Mad Men embodies timeless winter elegance.

With her sophisticated coats, chic gloves, and perfectly styled hair, Betty’s cold-weather wardrobe is as polished as her socialite demeanor.

She makes even the harshest winter day look like a runway moment, effortlessly blending classic silhouettes with cozy sophistication.

Whether she’s attending a holiday party or braving the snowy streets of the ’60s suburbs, Betty’s style is a masterclass in vintage glamour. Winter may be chilly, but Betty always brings the heat!

Watch Mad Men Online

Blair Waldorf — Gossip Girl

Blair Waldorf from Gossip Girl is the undisputed queen of winter fashion.

With her tailored coats, statement headbands, and luxurious scarves, Blair transforms the chilly streets of Manhattan into her personal runway.

She knows how to layer with elegance, mixing textures and colors to create cozy and chic outfits.

Whether she’s strolling through Central Park or scheming on the Upper East Side, Blair’s winter wardrobe screams sophistication. No snowstorm could ever dull her sparkle — she’s pure winter royalty!

Watch Gossip Girl Online

Rachel Green — Friends

Rachel Green from Friends brought her signature flair to winter fashion with effortless style.

From oversized turtlenecks and sleek trench coats to chic knit beanies, Rachel proved that staying warm doesn’t mean sacrificing sophistication.

As a fashion professional, she always knew how to pair timeless staples with trendy accents, creating practical and enviable looks.

Whether she was braving the New York chill or lounging at Central Perk, Rachel’s winter wardrobe was as iconic as her hairstyles — and just as unforgettable!

Watch Friends Online

Lorelai Gilmore — Gilmore Girls

Lorelai Gilmore from Gilmore Girls is a quirky and cozy winter fashion queen.

Lorelai’s cold-weather wardrobe is as charming as Stars Hollow, from her colorful knit hats to her endless array of stylish coats.

She masters the art of layering, pairing bold scarves with playful sweaters that reflect her vibrant personality.

Whether she’s sipping coffee at Luke’s or planning the next town festival, Lorelai’s outfits radiate warmth and whimsy. Snowy days and frosty nights never looked so fun — or fashionable!

Watch Gilmore Girls Online

Emily Cooper — Emily in Paris

Emily Cooper from Emily in Paris brings Parisian chic to winter fashion with her bold, eye-catching ensembles.

From statement coats in vibrant colors to berets that scream French sophistication, Emily’s wardrobe turns the city’s chilly streets into her personal catwalk.

She’s never afraid to mix patterns, textures, or daring accessories, creating outfits that are as adventurous as her personality.

Whether she’s navigating work drama or enjoying a snowy stroll by the Seine, Emily’s winter style is pure haute couture magic. Fashion faux pas? Not in her vocabulary!

Watch Emily in Paris Online

Villanelle — Killing Eve

Villanelle from Killing Eve turns winter fashion into a deadly art form.

With her love of bold silhouettes and luxurious fabrics, she effortlessly blends high fashion with a hint of danger.

Whether she’s rocking a statement coat or a tailored ensemble fit for a spy thriller, Villanelle’s winter wardrobe commands attention.

She treats every snowy backdrop like a runway, proving that style is a killer instinct even in the dead of winter. When it comes to turning heads, Villanelle never misses her mark.

Watch Killing Eve Online

Jessica Pearson — Suits

Jessica Pearson from Suits redefines winter power dressing with her sleek and sophisticated wardrobe.

Her tailored coats, luxurious scarves, and impeccably polished boots exude confidence and class, making every icy sidewalk her personal runway.

Jessica’s style commands attention, blending sharp business chic with understated elegance that never sacrifices warmth.

Whether she’s heading to court or owning the boardroom, her winter outfits are a masterclass in high-end professionalism. Cold weather has nothing on Jessica’s cool, collected fashion sense.

Watch Suits Online

Cookie Lyon — Empire

Cookie Lyon from Empire brings unapologetic flair to winter fashion.

With her bold fur coats, glittering accessories, and sky-high heels, Cookie doesn’t just brave the cold — she conquers it in style.

Her wardrobe is all about making a statement, whether she’s handling family drama or running her music empire.

Leopard print in a snowstorm? Absolutely. Cookie’s larger-than-life fashion ensures she’s always the center of attention, proving that even in winter, she’s a force to be reckoned with.

Watch Empire Online

Olivia Pope — Scandal

Olivia Pope from Scandal epitomizes winter elegance, combining practicality with high-end sophistication effortlessly.

Her iconic tailored coat collection, luxurious capes, and perfectly draped scarves could make any chilly day feel glamorous.

Olivia’s muted color palette and impeccable accessorizing reflect her no-nonsense approach, while her timeless style speaks volumes about her powerful presence.

Whether she’s handling a crisis or sipping red wine at home, Olivia’s winter wardrobe is just as captivating as her command of the room.

Watch Scandal Online

Betty Cooper — Riverdale

Betty Cooper from Riverdale keeps winter fashion cozy and cute while staying true to her all-American charm.

From her classic pea coats to soft, pastel sweaters, Betty’s wardrobe blends warmth with a touch of timeless style.

Her signature ponytail might be a constant, but her scarves and hats add a playful twist to her cold-weather outfits.

Whether she’s solving mysteries or grabbing milkshakes at Pop’s, Betty’s winter looks are effortlessly chic and totally relatable. Snowy small-town vibes never looked so good!

Watch Riverdale Online

Lady Mary Crawley — Downton Abbey

Lady Mary Crawley from Downton Abbey brings aristocratic elegance to winter fashion.

Her tailored coats, luxurious furs, and delicate gloves showcase a refined style that’s as regal as the Crawley estate itself.

Lady Mary’s winter wardrobe exudes sophistication, blending Edwardian grace with her bold, modern spirit.

Whether she’s strolling the snowy grounds of Downton or attending a glamorous event, her outfits always command admiration.

Winter may be harsh, but Lady Mary faces it with poise, charm, and impeccable style.

Watch Downton Abbey Online

Moira Rose — Schitt’s Creek

Moira Rose from Schitt’s Creek turns winter fashion into a theatrical spectacle.

With her over-the-top fur coats, avant-garde hats, and a flair for the dramatic, Moira’s wardrobe is anything but ordinary.

She layers bold patterns, textures, and statement accessories in ways only she can pull off, proving that fashion is art — even in a snowstorm.

Whether she’s delivering a monologue or sipping her Herb Ertlinger fruit wine, Moira’s winter looks are as unforgettable as her one-liners. Who needs subtlety when you have Moira Rose?

Watch Schitt's Creek Online

Janine Teagues — Abbott Elementary

Janine Teagues from Abbott Elementary brings a relatable charm to winter fashion.

With her cozy sweaters, practical coats, and colorful scarves, Janine’s style is all about staying warm while juggling the chaos of her classroom.

She mixes comfort with a touch of whimsy, reflecting her optimistic and quirky personality.

Whether she’s wrangling her students or navigating staff drama, Janine’s winter wardrobe is as endearing as her can-do spirit.

Snowy days are no match for her sunny disposition and cute, practical outfits!

Watch Abbott Elementary Online

Julia (Julia)

Available to watch on YouTube

Julia Baker from Julia redefined elegance with her understated yet polished winter wardrobe.

Her chic coats, tailored ensembles, and tasteful accessories reflected the sophistication of a professional single mother navigating life with grace.

Julia’s fashion wasn’t just stylish — it was aspirational, embodying the era’s push for modernity while staying timeless.

Whether she was caring for her son or working as a nurse, her outfits radiated confidence and class. Julia’s winter style remains a testament to simplicity done right, proving that less is often more.

Miriam “Midge” Maisel — The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel

Miriam “Midge” Maisel from The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel dazzles in winter fashion with her vintage-inspired wardrobe, which is equal parts glamorous and playful.

Her stunning coats in rich jewel tones, elegant gloves, and chic hats make every snowy New York sidewalk feel like a fashion runway.

Midge’s style reflects her vibrant personality and impeccable taste, blending 1950s sophistication with a modern flair.

Whether she’s performing on stage or navigating her next big break, Midge’s winter looks always steal the show.

Watch The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel Online

Mabel Mora — Only Murders in the Building

Mabel Mora from Only Murders in the Building brings edgy sophistication to winter fashion.

With her statement coats, bold beanies, and effortlessly cool layers, Mabel’s style is as mysterious as the cases she’s solving.

She’s a master of mixing practicality with flair, making even a cold New York day look effortlessly chic.

Whether she’s unraveling a murder mystery or making witty comebacks, Mabel’s winter wardrobe exudes confidence and urban cool. Snowfall or not, she’s always dressed to impress.

Watch Only Murders in the Building Online

Chilling in Style: Who Rocks Winter Wardrobes Best?

These TV characters prove that winter is the perfect time to showcase your fashion game. Whether it’s bold coats, cozy layers, or glamorous accessories, they’ve inspired us to embrace the season in style.

Now it’s your turn — who do you think has the hottest winter wardrobe on TV?

Did your favorite make the list, or do you have a frosty fashion icon we missed? Drop your picks in the comments, and let the wardrobe wars begin!
